source.name: DeFi Oracle Use Cases
source.instructions: Which of the following is NOT a use case for oracles in Decentralized Finance (DeFi)?

answers.answer: Providing real-time price data for cryptocurrencies and other assets
Calculating interest rates for lending platforms

source.guidance:
The correct answer is "Storing wallet keys." Oracles do not manage a users private and public keys. 

 The other options are all valid use cases for oracles in DeFi: they provide real-time price data for various assets, help in calculating interest rates on lending platforms, assist in maintaining stablecoin pegs, and provide data that can trigger liquidations in collateralized lending scenarios. This question tests the student's understanding of the specific roles oracles play in DeFi applications, distinguishing between data provision (which oracles do) and transaction execution (which they don't).
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify and analyze specific use cases for oracles in Decentralized Finance (DeFi)
